result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany R. Baker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling per agent.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tiffany R. Baker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tiffany R. Baker in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klopp states matter is resolved.  State gives recommendation.  Plea to Count 1.  Victim notification met.  State amends charge.  Attorney Klopp agrees as stated.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:  Misd retail theft
12 months Probation
Undergo any counseling per agent.
$132.16 Restitution with 10% Surcharge To: Lake Delton Walmart.  JOINT AND SEVERAL w/ co-defendant.
$243.00 costs, $200.00 DNA surcharge and $10.00 surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Tiffany R. Baker in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PTC completed.  Likely to resolve.  Request short reset.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on March 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Return date on March 25, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tiffany R. Baker in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klopp request PTC/RD.  Bond continues.  Time limits continued waived.  Victim notification met.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
No contact with Wal mart and booking on Feb 18 at 1 p.m.
Return date on February 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tiffany R. Baker in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms address.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney. Defendant pleads not guilty.  Court quashes warrant.  State request signature bond.  Time limits waived.  Defendant request to speak with PD office.  $2500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with any Wal-mart.  Booking on Wed. Feb. 18, 2015 at 1 p.m.  Return date scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
